notes: Compact pickup sharing platform with Chevrolet S-10. Called S-15 in 1980s, renamed Sonoma in 1991. Four-wheel drive Insta-Trac system added 1983. Extended cab introduced 1983. Name continued into 1990s-2000s. Data sourced from Wikipedia Chevrolet S-10 article, October 11, 2025 revision.

Compact SUV based on S-10 platform, smaller than full-size Jimmy. Only 2-door available in 1980s (4-door added 1991). Optional diesel engine available. V6 received throttle-body fuel injection in 1986. 4.3L V6 became sole engine 1989. Data sourced from Wikipedia Chevrolet S-10 Blazer article, October 11, 2025 revision.

Mid-size van sharing platform with Chevrolet Astro. GM's first response to Chrysler minivans using S-10 light-truck components. 111-inch wheelbase. AWD became available in 1990. Standard and extended length options. Data sourced from Wikipedia Chevrolet Astro article, October 11, 2025 revision.

GMT400 Sierra launched in 1988, replacing C/K designation with Sierra branding for GMC. Introduced independent front suspension on 4WD models and fuel injection. Optional 6.2L Detroit Diesel. Continued production through 1999-2000. Data sourced from Wikipedia GMC Sierra/Chevrolet Silverado articles, October 11, 2025 revision.

Rebadged Suzuki Sidekick sold exclusively in Canadian market through GMC dealerships. Base and SLE trims available. Discontinued 1991 when renamed As√ºna Sunrunner. Light-duty off-road vehicle. Data sourced from Wikipedia Geo Tracker article, October 11, 2025 revision.

engines: Various diesel and gasoline options (medium-duty commercial)
notes: Medium-duty commercial truck series for vocational applications. TopKick branding introduced in 1980s. C-Series designation covers multiple weight ratings (C4500-C8500). Commercial chassis cab configuration requiring specialized knowledge for air brakes and commercial drivetrains. Limited consumer documentation available.

Heavy-duty conventional truck for commercial/vocational use. Part of GMC's commercial truck lineup alongside General. Requires specialized commercial vehicle service knowledge including air brake systems, heavy-duty transmissions, and commercial diesel engines. Limited consumer market documentation available.
